@graph.caption: a stack of vegan pumpkin pancakes

@graph.name: Vegan Pumpkin Pancakes - Vegan Richa
@graph.description: Ditch the pancake mix and make a stack of fluffy Vegan Pumpkin Pancakes from scratch with this easy recipe.

@graph.name: Vegan Pumpkin Pancakes
@graph.description: Ditch the pancake mix and make a stack of fluffy Vegan Pumpkin Pancakes from scratch with this easy recipe. A quick vegan buttermilk pancake batter swirled with a mix of pumpkin puree, brown sugar, maple syrup, and pumpkin pie spice. Fall-tastic! Gluten-free option + soy-free +Nutfree .  Makes 8-10 pancakes
recipeIngredient: 3 tablespoons brown sugar or coconut sugar
good pinch of clove powder and allspice

recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl, mix the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: In a bowl, mix the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt and set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: In another bowl, mix the milk, vinegar, water, oil, and vanilla and set aside to curdle.
recipeInstructions.name: In another bowl, mix the milk, vinegar, water, oil, and vanilla and set aside to curdle.

recipeInstructions.text: In a small skillet, add the pumpkin puree with the maple, sugar, and spices and mix well. Cook until the mixture starts to bubble nicely and thickens and starts to get fragrant.
recipeInstructions.name: In a small skillet, add the pumpkin puree with the maple, sugar, and spices and mix well. Cook until the mixture starts to bubble nicely and thickens and starts to get fragrant.

recipeInstructions.text: Once it's bubbling, cook for another minute and then switch off heat. Let this mixture cool a little bit.
recipeInstructions.name: Once it's bubbling, cook for another minute and then switch off heat. Let this mixture cool a little bit.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix the milk mixture into the flour mixture until well combined to make pancake batter
recipeInstructions.name: Mix the milk mixture into the flour mixture until well combined to make pancake batter

recipeInstructions.text: Then lightly fold in the pumpkin puree mixture until it's half combined and half kind of swirly (see pictures).
recipeInstructions.name: Then lightly fold in the pumpkin puree mixture until it's half combined and half kind of swirly (see pictures).

recipeInstructions.text: Heat your pancake skillet. When it's hot,  add a drizzle of oil and spread all over with a paper towel.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat your pancake skillet. When it's hot,  add a drizzle of oil and spread all over with a paper towel.

recipeInstructions.text: Then pour a 1/4 to 1/3 cup of the pancake mix on the skillet and cook 3-4 minutes per side. Repeat for all the batter and serve freshly cooked
recipeInstructions.name: Then pour a 1/4 to 1/3 cup of the pancake mix on the skillet and cook 3-4 minutes per side. Repeat for all the batter and serve freshly cooked

recipeInstructions.text: You can also bake this mixture into sheet pancakes. To make this sheet pancakes, add 2 tablespoons of almond flour and 2 tablespoons of more flour into the mixture and mix and then pour into a greased 9 by 13 inch or larger baking sheet and then bake at 400 degrees Fahrenheit for 15-20 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: You can also bake this mixture into sheet pancakes. To make this sheet pancakes, add 2 tablespoons of almond flour and 2 tablespoons of more flour into the mixture and mix and then pour into a greased 9 by 13 inch or larger baking sheet and then bake at 400 degrees Fahrenheit for 15-20 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve the pancakes with maple syrup, vegan butter, or candied pecans.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve the pancakes with maple syrup, vegan butter, or candied pecans.
